required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Novel Imaging Tools in Newly-diagnosed Patients With Cardiac AL Amyloidosis
clinical_study.official_title: Molecular, Magnetic Resonance, and Echocardiographic Imaging Combined With Biomarkers of Cardiac and Clonal Disease to Predict Survival and Assess Response to Therapy in Cardiac AL Amyloidosis

brief_summary.textblock: This will be a systematic, combined, prospective assessment of the novel echographic, CMR, and PET imaging tools in newly-diagnosed patients with cardiac AL amyloidosis at baseline and after treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the prognostic relevance of advanced imaging variables.
primary_outcome.description: - for CMR: T1, T2, ECV, indexed volumes, mass, ejection fraction (EF);

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the prognostic relevance of advanced imaging variables.
primary_outcome.description: - for echocardiography: left ventricular wall thickness (mLVW), EF, 2D-GLS, midwall fractional shortening (mFS), and stroke volume index (SVI);

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the prognostic relevance of advanced imaging variables.
Evaluation of advanced imaging variables in response assessment.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after initiation of chemotherapy targeting the amyloid plasma cell clone
primary_outcome.description: The same variables considered at baseline will be measured 6 months after initiation of chemotherapy targeting the amyloid plasma cell clone. Changes in these variables compared to baseline will be considered.
